result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Colin J Hogan

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Colin J Hogan not in court, in custody.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Colin J Hogan.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defense requests a plea and sentencing hearing. Court grants the defenses request. Case adjourned to Branch 36.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Colin J Hogan in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Defendant Colin J Hogan in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a plea and sentencing.  Defense requests an adjournment.  Defendant has a pending matter in Waukesha County.  Defense acknowledges receipt of discovery and an offer.  Court scheduled a status conference.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court, defendant Colin J Hogan not in court, in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  **All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court, defendant Colin J Hogan not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received global offer with pending case in Branch 16 and request case set for hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Colin J Hogan in court with Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg; both appear by video.  Defendant Colin J Hogan in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 17CF4693. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer B. Rutherford. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Colin J Hogan in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Colin J Hogan in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Colin J Hogan appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
